body:
**What happened**: After #24614 / #68438  we had 283 known failing `*.sh` files being excluded from shellcheck lints.

**What you expected to happen**: We should be linting all files. When files are listed in `hack/.shellcheck_failures` we may miss actual bugs in them. Initially to get the linter in place we had to list many files there to keep the PR reasonably sized, but ideally we can fix these over time and eliminate this file.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**: `hack/verify-shellcheck.sh`

**Anything else we need to know?**: I intend to continue working on this, EG #72861, #72955, ...

/sig testing
/assign

### Known failing files TODO:


 - [x] ./build/build-image/rsyncd.sh (Done in: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/72955)
 - [x] ./build/common.sh (Done in: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/73117)

labels.description: Denotes an issue that needs help from a contributor. Must meet "help wanted" guidelines.
labels.name: help wanted

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to cleaning up code, process, or technical debt.
labels.name: kind/cleanup

labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed and/or may need multiple releases to complete.
labels.name: priority/important-longterm

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: Eliminate shellcheck failures
